item.title: Ban broke
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

[code]Arraylist<String, String> bannedUsers = new ArrayList<String, String>();

void appendBan(String user, String banner) {
bannedUsers.put(user, banner);
}[/code]

Also logs who bans you.

Read full topic

item.title: Ban broke
item.dc:creator: @musicmad441 Musicmad
item.description:
@musicmad441 wrote:

[quote="_Vengeance, post:3, topic:182923"]That is fucking dirty.
What is javac saying about it?

Musicmad: Yours is also awful. It opens a new BufferedWriter every time you want to ban someone.
If you see the need to keep it in a text file, at least use a static writer.
It would be much better to use a Hash table for things like bans.[/quote]

No, it logs who banned who, so you can see in the logs.

Read full topic

item.title: Ban broke
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

That is fucking dirty.
What is javac saying about it?

Musicmad: Yours is also awful. It opens a new BufferedWriter every time you want to ban someone.
If you see the need to keep it in a text file, at least use a static writer.
It would be much better to use a Hash table for things like bans.

Read full topic

item.title: Ban broke
item.dc:creator: @musicmad441 Musicmad
item.description:
@musicmad441 wrote:

[quote=“snakeman2058, post:1, topic:182923”]else if(command.startsWith(“pls”))
{
String victim = command.substring(4);
PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
victim = victim.replace(" ", “_”);
//System.out.println(“");
//System.out.println(“Admin:”+playerName+" is banning "+victim);
//System.out.println("”);
appendToBanned(victim);
}

whats the problem?[/quote]

That is an awful ban command, use this one:

[code]else if(command.startsWith(“banuser”) && playerRights >= 2) {
String victim = command.substring(8);
PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Admin:”+playerName+" is banning "+victim;
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully banned”);
appendToBanned(victim);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/banlogs.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" banned"+victim);
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging bans!");
 }
  }

  try {
    // bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("C:/Documents and Settings/Jordan.pimp/My Documents/my server stuff/adminpk/banlogs.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" banned"+victim);
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging bans!");
 }
  }

}[/code]

To ban someone you would type:

::banuser playername

Read full topic
